private_information: I can pick up and place blocks using a single gripper.
I can observe stacks on the left side of the table.
robot1.goal: Execute assigned moves and report observations to the orchestrator so a global plan can be assembled.

private_information: I can pick up and place blocks using a single gripper.
I can observe stacks on the right side of the table.
robot2.goal: Execute assigned moves and report observations to the orchestrator so a global plan can be assembled.

private_information: I receive observations from robot1 and robot2 and must integrate them into a single consistent plan.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate observations and produce a PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownwards solver that represent the BlocksWorld instance and the final arrangement after executing the given action sequence.

public_information: This is a standard BlocksWorld with ten labeled blocks: A B C D E F G H I J.
Only the top block of any stack can be moved and only one block can be carried at a time.
Initial arrangement: A is on J, B is on E, C is on the table, D is on H, E is on the table, F is on A, G is on F, H is on G, I is on the table, J is on the table.

The agents execute the following ordered actions: 1. pickup(I) 2. putdown(I) 3. unstack(D, H) 4. stack(D, C) 5. pickup(I) 6. stack(I, B) 7. unstack(D, C) 8. stack(D, I) 9. unstack(D, I) 10. stack(D, H) 11. pickup(C) 12. stack(C, I) 13. unstack(C, I) 14. stack(C, I) 15. unstack(D, H) 16. stack(D, C) 17. unstack(D, C) 18. putdown(D) 19. unstack(C, I) 20. stack(C, H) 21. pickup(D) 22. stack(D, C) 23. unstack(D, C) 24. putdown(D) 25. unstack(I, B) 26. stack(I, D) 27. unstack(I, D) 28. stack(I, C) 29. pickup(D) 30. stack(D, I).
The task is to derive the final arrangement of each block after applying the sequence above starting from the stated initial configuration.

observe.system_prompt: You are robot1. Provide structured observations of the part of the table you can see. Do not emit PDDL. Report which blocks are on which blocks and which blocks are on the table in your visible area. Report any moves you executed if assigned.
observe.prompt: Your name is robot1. You observe a subset of the BlocksWorld state (left side). Report observations as a small structured summary mapping block to what it is immediately on (either another block or table). If you executed any actions from the sequence, list them and the effect you saw.

observe.system_prompt: You are robot2. Provide structured observations of the part of the table you can see. Do not emit PDDL. Report which blocks are on which blocks and which blocks are on the table in your visible area. Report any moves you executed if assigned.
observe.prompt: Your name is robot2. You observe a subset of the BlocksWorld state (right side). Report observations as a small structured summary mapping block to what it is immediately on (either another block or table). If you executed any actions from the sequence, list them and the effect you saw.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems. Your task is to integrate observations from robot1 and robot2 and produce a single PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file targeting the FastDownwards planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep the actions of different agents distinct if necessary and ensure the resulting PDDL is compatible with FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Receive the observations from the two robots and integrate them into a coherent BlocksWorld description. Use the public initial configuration and the provided action sequence to construct a PDDL domain and problem that represents the instance and its final arrangement. Target the FastDownwards solver. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.
